They called him artificial life, which to me implies
he's partially organic.

--- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@...> wrote:
> I have to mention Star Trek's Data, who is said to
> be an android even 
> if he is wholly technological.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Hollywood Narrator"
> <thecode@p...> wrote:
> > OOC: Ah, I see. But if you're using Dragon Ball Z
> as an example, ( I 
> said IF, I am not accusing) in Japan they called
> them "Artificial 
> Human" instead of androids. Keeping in mind that the
> English versions 
> are extremely stupid, I wouldn't trust those suckas.
> I myself would 
> classify the characters like 17 and 18 of DBZ as
> cyborgs. King of like 
> in The Terminator, except they feel pain where the
> terminator didn't. 
> Geez, man, why did Dr. Gero make his machines feel
> pain? I guess so 
> they can have the ability to heal themselves like
> the Terminator did 
> not.
> > 
> > Just me rambling on...
> > 
> >   ----- Original Message -----

> isn't organtic, not a
